page.title: 04Bourtie Kirk history
page.content: Bourtie Kirk is mentioned in Church Records as having Hugh the Rector as leader of his flock earlier than 1190 A.D, but there are signs of even earlier activity. Built into the church all when it was rebuilt in 1806 is a Class 1 (incised) Pictish symbol stone, complete with double disc and z-rod, cescent and V-rod, and miror and comb. It is protected from the prevailing winds in its position high on the south wall of the kirk and also by the yew and cedar trees which grow close by. The Kirk is also the repository of a medieval knight and his lady, whose efigies are built into th vestry wall, along with other artifacts from previous ministries like the 1760 bell cast in Old Aberdeen, and the rail wooden collection ladle made in 1671.
